Congress has a lot to do in modernizing the disability claims process and helping our veterans get the benefits they deserve. I am thrilled to have the opportunity to fight for them.

As a veteran, I am honored to lead the House Veterans’ Affairs Subcommittee on Disability Assistance and Memorial Affairs and help our American heroes succeed after their service. https://luria.house.gov/media/press-releases/congresswoman-elaine-luria-lead-veterans-subcommittee …

I was happy to support a pay raise our federal workers deserve. They should never be used as political pawns again. https://luria.house.gov/media/press-releases/congresswoman-elaine-luria-supports-pay-raise-federal-workers …

Federal employees protect our children, patrol our borders, secure our flights, beautify our parks, clean our air, inspect our food, purify our water, staff our museums, help the hungry, house the homeless, and much, much more.
https://luria.house.gov/media/press-releases/congresswoman-elaine-luria-cosponsors-paycheck-fairness-act …

I’m serving in Congress to ensure equality for my daughter and every American woman. Ten years after the Lilly Ledbetter Fair Pay Act was signed into law, women are still battling the wage gap. Pay discrimination has no place in America. Proud to support the #PaycheckFairnessAct

So many Virginians have served honorably & put their lives on the line for America, yet they have difficulty accessing the care they were promised. Being on this committee gives me a unique opportunity to advocate for my fellow veterans, and I’m honored to fight on their behalf.

I am honored to announce my appointment to the House Committee on Veterans' Affairs. As a 20-year Navy veteran and the spouse of a 27-year veteran, I know firsthand the challenges of receiving care and services through the Department of Veterans Affairs. https://luria.house.gov/media/press-releases/congresswoman-elaine-luria-joins-house-committee-veterans-affairs …

Senate Republicans should do the sensible thing and pass bipartisan House legislation to reopen government immediately. Failing that, our top priority in Congress should be making it easier for federal workers to pay their bills and live their lives.

Our federal workforce should be able to access their hard-earned money during disruptive political breakdowns they had no role in causing.  Throughout this shutdown, Virginians have contacted my office with stories of lengthy furlough periods or working without pay.

Proud to introduce my first bill, joined by a bipartisan group of 11 original cosponsors. The Shutdown Relief Act would provide relief to federal workers suffering from the financial repercussions of the government shutdown. Read more here: https://luria.house.gov/media/press-releases/congresswoman-elaine-luria-introduces-bipartisan-shutdown-relief-act …

Today I was on @CNN to discuss the importance of visiting our troops in Afghanistan. As a member of the House Armed Services Committee and House Committee on Veterans' Affairs, I take seriously my responsibility to listen, learn, and deliver for our service members in harm's way. pic.twitter.com/nVDGhwduFV
Oversight is the responsibility of Congress, and it is inappropriate for the President to interfere with our constitutional duties.

As a 20-year Navy veteran, new member of the House Armed Services Committee, and new member of the House Committee on Veterans’ Affairs, it is my duty to support our troops and learn everything I can about their mission.
The President’s comment that lawmakers visiting Afghanistan is a “public relations event” is an insult to the brave men and women serving in harm’s way. pic.twitter.com/qAH4XMaoYj

If Senate Republicans refuse to open government, Congress should stay in Washington this weekend to pass new bipartisan legislation I’ve cosponsored to fund our Coast Guard. https://www.13newsnow.com/article/news/politics/congresswoman-luria-cosponsors-bill-to-pay-coast-guard-during-shutdown/291-fb7dfbd2-07fd-4bf7-bf35-10e8ca86a055 …

Shutdown, Day 21.   Our Coast Guard continues to work without pay.  The Coast Guard is the only service branch operating without pay during the shutdown.  Families in my district are struggling. https://wtkr.com/2019/01/10/local-lawmakers-community-members-rally-behind-families-affected-by-government-shutdown/ …
The Coast Guard falls under the Department of Homeland Security, so it is the only service branch currently running without funding during the shutdown.

We rely on our brave Coast Guard to provide maritime safety, security, and stewardship.  Members of our maritime security service need to put food on the table, fill their gas tanks, and pay their rent or mortgage.  They should never bear the burden of political breakdowns. #VA02

Proud to be an original cosponsor of new bipartisan legislation that would ensure United States Coast Guard members are paid during the duration of the government shutdown. https://luria.house.gov/media/press-releases/congresswoman-elaine-luria-cosponsors-bipartisan-bill-would-pay-coast-guard …

The 20-day shutdown has gone on far too long.  Yesterday I voted for a House bill that would reopen the Treasury Dept. and Internal Revenue Service to ensure that Virginians receive their tax refunds in-full and on time.  I call on Senate Republicans to quickly follow suit.

Today I voted to protect Virginia’s historic Medicaid expansion & overall access to affordable health care.  Our focus should be lowering health care costs & the price of prescription drugs – not gutting protections for people with pre-existing conditions. https://luria.house.gov/media/press-releases/congresswoman-elaine-luria-votes-protect-virginians-pre-existing-conditions …

Shutdown, Day 19.  Families are hurting.  Nearly 30K Virginians — Coast Guard members, TSA staff, and more — are furloughed or working without pay.  That’s why I’ve directed the Chief Administrative Officer of the House to withhold my pay until federal employees are made whole. pic.twitter.com/bKduAOgKjQ

Tonight the President said it’s “immoral” to “do nothing,” but the House has passed bipartisan legislation that would open government.  It’s long past time for this 18-day shutdown to end.  Our Coast Guard, TSA, and other federal workers shouldn’t be hostages in political fights.

Proud to join @MarkWarner and @timkaine in support of funding for the rehabilitation of a section of @ColonialParkNPS. An unforgettable first day representing #VA02 in Congress. Voted to reopen the federal government and hosted Coastal Virginians at our office’s Open House — so thankful to all who made the trip! https://www.dailypress.com/news/virginia/dp-nws-elaine-luria-swearing-in-116th-congress-20181228-story,amp.html …

I’m proud that House Democrats wasted no time presenting solutions to Coastal Virginians and all Americans. Senate Republicans should join us in support of tonight's measure so we can reopen government and turn our focus to the problems that Americans elected us to solve.
So glad to connect with #VA02. Please click here to follow my Facebook page!  https://www.facebook.com/RepElaineLuria/

I don’t believe it’s fair or appropriate for Members of Congress to continue to receive paychecks while federal employees & their families suffer. I’ve directed the Chief Administrative Officer of the House to withhold my pay until all our federal employees have been made whole. pic.twitter.com/o0AQHnJWvM

I’ll work tirelessly to honor our service members, veterans, and military families; protect Social Security and Medicare; safeguard our environment; speak truth to power; and make affordable health care more accessible.

It is the honor of my lifetime to serve in Congress and represent Coastal Virginia, and I look forward to working on behalf of every person living in my district. Everything I do will be informed by what makes Virginia and America stronger.
